metadata.job_to_be_done: Prepare a vegetarian buffet-style dinner menu for a corporate gathering, including gluten-free items.

subsection_analysis.refined_text:
Layer 3 noodles, half the ricotta
mixture, half the vegetables, and 1/3 of the mozzarella. Repeat layers.
• Top with remaining noodles, marinara sauce, mozzarella, and Parmesan cheese.
• Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. Add spinach and cook until wilted.
• In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese, egg, salt, and pepper.
• In a baking dish, spread a thin layer of marinara sauce

Sopa de Tortilla
• Ingredients:
o 4 corn tortillas
o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 4 cups chicken broth
o 2 tomatoes
o 1 teaspoon cumin
o 1 avocado
o 1/4 cup cilantro
• Instructions:
o Cut tortillas into strips and fry in oil until crispy.
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in a pot until translucent.
o Add diced tomatoes and cumin, cook for 5 minutes.
o Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil.
o Simmer for 10 minutes.
o Serve soup topped with tortilla strips, diced avocado, and chopped cilantro.

Instructions:
• Lay the tortilla flat and spread the hummus evenly.
• Add the turkey, carrots, and spinach.
• Roll up the tortilla tightly and slice in half.

Ingredients:
• 1 eggplant, diced
• 1 zucchini, diced
• 1 bell pepper, diced
• 1 small onion, diced
• 2 cloves garlic, minced
• 4 tomatoes, diced

Chiles Rellenos
• Ingredients:
o 4 poblano peppers
o 1 cup shredded cheese
o 1/2 cup flour
o 4 eggs
o 1 cup vegetable oil
o 1 cup tomato sauce
• Instructions:
o Roast peppers until charred, then peel and remove seeds.
o Stuff peppers with cheese.
o Separate eggs and beat whites until stiff, then fold in yolks.
o Dredge peppers in flour, then dip in egg mixture.
o Fry in hot oil until golden.
o Serve with warmed tomato sauce.
